name: Upgrade ASGs Launch template's AMI via Lazy.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces a process to automate the upgrade of Amazon Machine Images (AMIs) used by Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs) through a tool called Lazy. It explains that previously, this process was manual and time-consuming, involving creating a dummy pull request, planning, and creating a new version of the launch template. With Lazy, this process is now automated, making it more efficient and streamlined.
use_cases: Upgrading AMIs for Auto Scaling Groups
Automating the process of updating launch templates
Replacing manual and time-consuming processes with automated solutions

name: Upgrade ASGs Launch template's AMI via Lazy.txt - Command
description: This section explains a command called 'lazy' that can be used to upgrade the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) of the Launch Templates associated with Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs) in an Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) cluster. The command takes two parameters: '-a' for the action (upgrade_ami) and '-t' for the target (either specific ASG names or 'cluster' to upgrade all ASGs). It provides examples of the command syntax and usage, along with a screenshot showing the command in action. Additionally, it includes links to guides for rotating nodes and creating a Lazy container.
use_cases: Upgrading the AMI of Launch Templates for specific ASGs
Upgrading the AMI of Launch Templates for all ASGs in an EKS cluster
Rotating nodes after upgrading the AMI
Creating a Lazy container for running the 'lazy' command
capabilities: Target specific ASGs or entire EKS cluster
